title: Tom Brady’s WWE comments have landed him at the top of Randy Orton’s RKO list
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tom Brady called WWE 'cute' during a playful exchange on Logan Paul's podcast discussing the Fanatics Flag Football Classic.
Randy Orton reacted by saying he would love to use his signature RKO move on Brady after the comments.
Brady and NFL stars like Saquon Barkley and Rob Gronkowski will compete in the upcoming flag football event.

title: These were Monday’s highest reported wind gusts during the storm in Mass.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Wellfleet, Cape Cod recorded the highest wind gust at 83 mph during Monday's storm.
Chatham and West Falmouth experienced wind gusts of 77 mph and 72 mph, respectively.
Wind gusts over 60 mph were reported across Massachusetts, meeting blizzard criteria.

title: LeBron James on Jaylen Brown’s MVP chances: ‘I don’t understand’ why he’s not being talked about
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: LeBron James questions why Jaylen Brown's MVP chances aren't seriously considered, noting his 29.2 points, 7 rebounds, 4.9 assists average.
The Celtics, second in the East, outperformed expectations without Jayson Tatum, partly due to Brown's standout performance.
James remarks on the MVP's subjective nature and praises Brown's role in keeping Celtics competitive amidst a team overhaul.

title: Wachusett delayed opening, ski resorts putting lifts on wind hold
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Wachusett Mountain delayed opening on Monday due to a nor'easter bringing strong winds and heavy snowfall to New England.
Massachusetts Governor Maura Healey declared a state of emergency with 60-70 mph winds and 18-24 inches of snow reported.
Ski resorts like Mount Snow and Gunstock placed lifts on wind hold or reduced speeds due to adverse weather conditions.

title: Photo scroll: Blizzard whips across Mass. with heavy snow, high winds
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A major snowstorm hit the Northeast, with forecasts predicting over 2 feet of snow in some regions.
Images captured show snow impacting various areas, including Atlantic Avenue, Copley Square, and the Massachusetts State House.
The storm affected transportation, with plows and shoveling efforts visible across locations like Marshfield and Boston Common.

title: Market Basket stores in Mass. close early Monday due to the blizzard
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Market Basket closed all Massachusetts stores early on Monday due to a blizzard, affecting over 50 locations.
Some Market Basket stores in New Hampshire and Rhode Island also closed early due to the snowstorm.
Several Market Basket stores in Maine and New Hampshire, including Biddeford and Concord, remained open despite the weather.

title: Share your blizzard photos with Boston.com
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: A blizzard is impacting the Northeast U.S., causing heavy snowfall, strong winds, and low visibility on February 23, 2026.
Snowfall totals have reached double digits in some Massachusetts communities as the storm progresses.
Boston.com seeks blizzard photos from the public to feature in future articles.

title: Did you have to go into work during the blizzard?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Governor Maura Healey declared a state of emergency and urged non-emergency workers to stay home during the blizzard.
Some employers still require non-essential workers to report in person despite severe weather and available remote work options.
Certain businesses, like hotels, remain open to serve guests, while others provide creative solutions such as hotel rooms for staff.

title: Mass. plow driver survives near-impalement when tree limb crashes through truck windshield
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: A fallen tree limb crashed through a plow truck's windshield in Kingston, nearly impaling the driver.
Authorities warn drivers to stay off roads as a blizzard brings 18-24 inches of snow, causing severe conditions.
High winds and wet snow lead to power outages, MBTA service interruptions, and Logan Airport flight cancellations.

title: Citing ‘hate’ and child exploitation, AG Campbell logs off X
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts AG Andrea Campbell exits X over hate, disinformation, and child exploitation concerns.
Campbell criticized X for lacking accountability, citing the Grok AI controversy and its harmful capabilities.
Campbell continues her presence on social media through Bluesky and Threads, emphasizing responsible technology.
